title: Towards Reliable Item Sampling for Recommendation Evaluation. (arXiv:2211.15743v2 [cs.IR] UPDATED)
abstract: Since Rendle and Krichene argued that commonly used sampling-based evaluation metrics are "inconsistent" with respect to the global metrics (even in expectation), there have been a few studies on the sampling-based recommender system evaluation. Existing methods try either mapping the sampling-based metrics to their global counterparts or more generally, learning the empirical rank distribution to estimate the top-$K$ metrics. However, despite existing efforts, there is still a lack of rigorous theoretical understanding of the proposed metric estimators, and the basic item sampling also suffers from the "blind spot" issue, i.e., estimation accuracy to recover the top-$K$ metrics when $K$ is small can still be rather substantial. translated_title: 面向可靠的推荐评估的推荐物品采样研究
translated_abstract: 自从Rendle和Krichene认为常用的基于采样的评估方法与全局度量不一致后，已经有一些关于基于采样的推荐系统评估的研究。现有的方法要么将基于采样的度量映射到全局度量，要么更一般地学习经验排名分布来估计前K度量。但是，尽管存在许多努力，但仍然缺乏对所提出的度量估计器的严格理论理解，而基本的物品采样也面临“盲点”问题，即当K很小时，估计恢复前K度量的准确性仍然可以相当大。本文深入研究这些问题，并作出两项创新性贡献。首先，我们提出了一种新的物品采样估计器，显式地优化了与基础真实值的误差，并在理论上突显了其
tldr: 本文研究面向推荐系统评估的可靠物品采样方法，提出了一种新的采样估计器，优化误差和理论精度。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates reliable item sampling for recommendation evaluation, proposes a new sampling estimator that optimizes estimation error and theoretical precision.
